poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: My debt is the life I have left, and I'm paying ; I've been dealt a fine hand I can barely hold to my chest. Oh, if I could put a dent in this wall of law, now that would be something, But duty and debt accrue. Forget forgiveness Deft as the hands of a servant when she tucks in linen. Dressed in ancient clothing, decked in pearls stronger than the law She dreamt on sleeping waters and the dream Forgave Forgetfulness.
